parse: Conjunction
str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Noun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Martha, sister of Mary and Lazarus of Bethany. Probably of Chaldee origin; Martha, a Christian woman.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To distract, trouble greatly. From peri and spao; to drag all around, i.e. to distract.

parse: Preposition
str2: From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Noun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration. From diakonos; attendance; figuratively aid, service.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Noun - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: It is a care, it is an object of anxiety, it concerns. A primary verb; to be of interest to, i.e. To concern.

parse: Conjunction
str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Noun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Active
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.

parse: Adjective - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Conjunction
str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and antilambanomai; to take hold of opposite together, i.e. Co-operate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
